blogs.title: Getting Started with Next.js
blogs.author: Md Afridi Sk
blogs.excerpt: Learn how to set up a Next.js project from scratch and explore its key features.
blogs.content:
# Getting Started with Next.js Next.js is a powerful React framework that enables server-side rendering, static site generation, and more. In this blog post, we'll explore how to set up a Next.js project from scratch. ## Installation To create a new Next.js app, run the following command: ```bash npx create-next-app@latest my-next-app ``` This will create a new Next.js project in the `my-next-app` directory. ## Project Structure A typical Next.js project has the following structure: - `pages/`: Contains all the pages of your application - `public/`: Stores static assets like images - `styles/`: Contains CSS files - `components/`: Houses reusable React components ## Creating Pages In Next.js, pages are React components exported from files in the `pages` directory. Each page is associated with a route based on its filename. For example, to create a page at `/about`, you would create a file at `pages/about.js`: ```jsx export default function About() { return

About Us

; } ``` ## Data Fetching Next.js provides several methods for data fetching: - `getStaticProps`: Fetch data at build time - `getServerSideProps`: Fetch data on each request - `getStaticPaths`: Specify dynamic routes to pre-render ## Conclusion Next.js simplifies React development by providing a structured framework with powerful features out of the box. It's an excellent choice for building modern web applications.
